elements.name: el1503957437440
elements.label: Hero Headline
elements.microcopy: This is the text that appears over the image at the top of the page.

elements.name: el1503957437441
elements.label: Hero Deck
elements.value: Actors from across the sector are making public commitments to sustainable coffee to help track our progress. Isn’t it time to add yours?
elements.microcopy: This is the text that appears under the headline above.

elements.name: el1503957437442
elements.label: Body Text Intro
elements.value: The Commitments Hub showcases and tracks each partner’s unique contribution to making coffee the first sustainable agricultural product. Collecting and tracking commitments in this common, neutral space enables us to better understand and learn from and scale up the numerous efforts underway.
elements.microcopy: Body text starts here. If you don't have any subheads, you can paste all of the text here; if you want to use subheads, use the following fields to break up the copy accordingly.

elements.name: el1503957437443
elements.label: Subhead 1
elements.microcopy: This is your first subhead. All of these are optional (but encouraged!)

elements.name: el1503957437444
elements.label: Body Text 1
elements.value: Commitments generally take the form of investments and actions designed to achieve specific targets or outcomes. Commitments can be large or small, global or local. Every commitment matters, no matter the size or scope.

elements.name: el1505132298681
elements.label: 2 column bulleted list heading 1
elements.value: The Sustainable Coffee Challenge has developed the following principles to guide commitments:

elements.label: 2 column bulleted list 1
elements.value:
• Be new or active: Every commitment that is stated via the Sustainable Coffee Challenge should be either a new commitment or an existing commitment that has yet to be achieved.
  • Incorporate SMART objectives: Commitments should be Specific in what they set out to achieve, incorporate Measurable targets, be Ambitious in nature, Relevant for the industry, organization or supply chain that it is targeting, and be Time-bound.
  • Aim for impact: Commitments should consider the contribution to one or more of the 'Compass Points' – sustain supply, conserve nature, improve livelihoods, strengthen market demand.
  • Able to be reported on at set intervals: Organizations should enter commitments that can be reported on in the system on an annual or semi-annual basis with 1st, 2nd or 3rd party data.

elements.name: el1503957437448
elements.label: Body Text 3
elements.value: The Hub, powered by Supply Shift, prompts partners to enter commitments and report on progress using a step-by-step approach.
